How to Install rsyslog on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • rsyslog

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install rsyslog on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing rsyslog on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall rsyslog in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install rsyslog, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install rsyslog Using apt

To install rsyslog in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install rsyslog using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install rsyslog

The installation of rsyslog might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install rsyslog Using apt-get

To install rsyslog using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install rsyslog.

sudo apt-get -y install rsyslog

Install rsyslog Using Synaptic

To install rsyslog using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install rsyslog on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for rsyslog. This will display the rsyslog package in the package window, now to install rsyslog, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the rsyslog package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of rsyslog.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install rsyslog Using aptitude

To install rsyslog on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of rsyslog.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install rsyslog using the command aptitude install rsyslog.

sudo aptitude -y install rsyslog

How to Upgrade rsyslog on debian

If you want to upgrade the rsyslog package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade rsyslog using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade rsyslog to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade rsyslog.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade rsyslog sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade rsyslog

Upgrade rsyslog using Aptitude

To upgrade rsyslog using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade rsyslog.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade rsyslog

Upgrade rsyslog using Synaptic

To upgrade rsyslog using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for rsyslog, now right-click rsyslog, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade rsyslog just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall rsyslog on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall rsyslog from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just rsyslog, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove rsyslog

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of rsyslog

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of rsyslog you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge rsyslog

Remove rsyslog using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall rsyslog using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for rsyslog, right-click the rsyslog package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall rsyslog click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install rsyslog on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade rsyslog using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.
